originalText.text: I have called 8 different times throughout the last couple days but they haven’t picked up a single time. I work six days a week and can’t simply walk to the bank. This needs to be addressed by the manager of that branch location. If I cannot get into contact with the people who I trust to keep my money with, then I have no option other than to close my account.

originalText.text: One of the worst customer service I have ever received in my life. Absolutely abhorrent. The teller Catherine Reyes is an extremely disgusting, unpleasant woman. No regard for manners or anything - really ghetto and crass. It’s no surprise that there are so much bad reviews about this branch. If you can avoid going there, you should.

text.text: One of the worst customer service I have ever received in my life. Absolutely abhorrent. The teller Catherine Reyes is an extremely disgusting, unpleasant woman. No regard for manners or anything - really ghetto and crass. It’s no surprise that there are so much bad reviews about this branch. If you can avoid going there, you should.

originalText.text: Visited today at the scheduled opening time and it was closed with a sign on the door which read 9:30A opening time.  Ran an errand and returned at 9:35A, but it was still closed.  A worker approached the door to state the back would open "in a little while". When pressed for a more specific time, she stated: "I don't know, maybe and 1 hour to 1 1/2 hour", check later".  The lack of respect and sensitivity given the situation in NYC.  I an elderly person trying hard to get all my critical errands in before it gets worse.   This would never happen in an affluent neighborhood--outright disrespectful.  It is part of an established pattern at this location.  I must add, the tellers are great, kind, helpful and always respectful. Management needs improvement.
